user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2 is: Functions shall not call themselves, either directly or indirectly.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_CondVarWait_Impl:
```c
int32 OS_CondVarWait_Impl(const OS_object_token_t *token)
{
    int                                status;
    OS_impl_condvar_internal_record_t *impl;

    impl = OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(OS_impl_condvar_table, *token);

    /*
     * note that because pthread_cond_wait is a cancellation point, this needs to
     * employ the same protection that is in the binsem module.  In the event that
     * the thread is canceled inside pthread_cond_wait, the mutex will be re-acquired
     * before the cancellation occurs, leaving the mutex in a locked state.
     */
    pthread_cleanup_push(OS_Posix_CondVarReleaseMutex, &impl->mut);
    status = pthread_cond_wait(&impl->cv, &impl->mut);
    pthread_cleanup_pop(false);

    if (status != 0)
    {
        return OS_ERROR;
    }

    return OS_SUCCESS;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are close to the target function OS_CondVarWait_Impl:
static inline osal_index_t OS_ObjectIndexFromToken(const OS_object_token_t *token)
{
    return token->obj_idx;
}
...
int32 OS_CondVarWait(osal_id_t var_id)
{
    OS_object_token_t token;
    int32             return_code;

    /* Check Parameters */
    return_code = OS_ObjectIdGetById(OS_LOCK_MODE_NONE, OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_CONDVAR, var_id, &token);
    if (return_code == OS_SUCCESS)
    {
        return_code = OS_CondVarWait_Impl(&token);
    }

    return return_code;
}
...
static void OS_Posix_CondVarReleaseMutex(void *mut)
{
    pthread_mutex_unlock(mut);
}
</additional code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
int32 OS_CondVarWait(osal_id_t var_id)
{
    OS_object_token_t token;
    int32             return_code;

    /* Check Parameters */
    return_code = OS_ObjectIdGetById(OS_LOCK_MODE_NONE, OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_CONDVAR, var_id, &token);
    if (return_code == OS_SUCCESS)
    {
        return_code = OS_CondVarWait_Impl(&token);
    }

    return return_code;
}
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 17.2 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation: OS_CondVarWait calls OS_CondVarWait_Impl, and OS_CondVarWait_Impl does not call OS_CondVarWait (nor any other function that calls it) in the provided code. A violation would occur if OS_CondVarWait_Impl (or any callee) called back to OS_CondVarWait, creating direct or indirect recursion.
